p.s: A Raisin in the Sun from Lorraine Hansberry is a play which takes place in Chicago's Southside during the time between World War II and the present.

It is about a black family living in America in a little house with just one window and where they share a bathroom with their neighbours and as a five-headed family have to live in two droom with kitchen and living room.
Their dad or Mama's husband has died and the family is waiting for a check of 10000$ to arrive.

They all have their individual dreams about what to do with the money and during the play there are a lot of conversations between the family members where becomes clear which dreams they have and how they want them to realize.
Through that you find a lot of contrasts between the family membersmembers' dreams and so do you in the scene I will analyze in the following tasks.
The extract of the scene shows a conversation between Walter Lee and her wife Ruth.

Walter was coming out of the bathroom and wants to tell Ruth about what he thought about, about what he wanted to do with the money from his dad, which is opening a liquor store together with his friends Willy and Bobo.
As you know from former conversations, Walter works as a chauffeur where he has to open white people the doors and drive them where they want to go.
He is clear about that he does not like his job.
As he talks to his wife he realizes that she does not listen to him and explains that she is sick about their family and their living conditions.
He goes on with showing to Ruth how much Mama listens to her, more as he does to him although she is just her mother-in-law.
Even though Ruth wants to be left alone, Walter justifies his dream.
He says that it is reliable because he has figured it out with his friends and explains why he has to invest in this store.
Finally Ruth gives up to prove his husband wrong about and just wants him to eat his eggs.
